definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: An estimated four thousand types of forams live in the world’s oceans.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，在海洋中生活着4000种有孔虫。

sentences.english: An investigation of foraminifera was conducted in the last glacial loess along the coast of the Bohai Sea.
sentences.chinese: 通过对渤海沿岸末次冰期黄土中有孔虫化石的研究。

sentences.english: Forams thus play a significant role in the carbon cycle. (Magnification 75x)
sentences.chinese: 有孔虫在整个地球的碳循环过程中扮演着重要的角色。

sentences.english: Foraminifera indicate an outer neritic paleobathymetric setting.
sentences.chinese: 有孔虫类显示了外围浅海的古代水深。

sentences.english: Most have intricate shells made of calcium carbonate.
sentences.chinese: 有孔虫大多具有错综复杂的碳酸钙甲壳。

sentences.english: But echinoderms apparently deliver more carbon to the sediments than do forams, for example.
sentences.chinese: 举例来说，棘皮动物传送到海底的碳明显比有孔虫多。

sentences.english: But these shells are absent from the foraminifera found in Challenger Deep.
sentences.chinese: 但是在查林杰海渊发现的这些有孔虫却没有这种甲壳。

sentences.english: Different types of foraminifera thrive at different temperatures.
sentences.chinese: 不同种类的有孔虫在不同温度下繁殖。

definition: shallow sea/sea less than 200 meters deep
